channel.title: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD)
channel.description: Daily Feed (Updated 9 AM BD) generated by script

item.title: When slogans and soundbites stand in for strategy
item.description: From Beijing to Washington, words only work if strategy and resources match promises.

item.title: Trump Escalates Venezuela Pressure With Oil Tanker Blockade
item.description: Critics fear this is a step toward the United States declaring war on Caracas.

item.title: Pete Hegseth Is Turning Political Theater Into Lethal Force
item.description: The U.S. is killing for the sake of spectacle.

item.title: How to Keep Gaza’s Recovery From Becoming an 80-Year Project
item.description: The coming year will determine whether the territory’s recovery can break the region’s cycle of violence.

item.title: Key Figure to Return for Bangladesh Elections
item.description: The long-exiled Tarique Rahman will arrive ahead of a likely tense February vote.

item.title: As Famine Worsens in Sudan, Aid Cuts Loom
item.description: The WFP says that it is forced to reduce rations to “the absolute minimum for survival.”

item.title: This Christmas, raise a glass to concentrated market returns
item.description: A surprisingly large share of companies lag far behind their former greatness

item.title: Retreating from EVs could be hazardous for Western carmakers
item.description: Governments are tempting a shift back to petrol

item.title: Saudi Arabia wants to host the world’s cheapest data centres
item.description: With plentiful land and electricity on hand, the kingdom thinks it has found an edge

item.title: A debate is raging over the origins of an elusive cousin to modern humans
item.description: Who were the Denisovans?

item.title: Donald Trump’s peace plan is faltering in the chaos of Gaza
item.description: But American officials insist the strip has a bright future

item.title: South Asian States Seek Cooperation—Without India
item.description: A proposed Bangladesh-China-Pakistan nexus could raise concerns in New Delhi.

item.title: EIU’s datasets now available in the Databricks Marketplace
item.description:
Economist Intelligence (EIU) has broadened visibility of its…

The post EIU’s datasets now available in the Databricks Marketplace appeared first on Economist Intelligence Unit.

item.title: Beware of Central Economic Forecasts for 2026
item.description: In statistical terms, the coming year will offer a multi-modal distribution of possibilities: a plausible path of robust, AI-led growth sits in the middle, flanked by a productivity miracle on one side and a risk-laden, bond-market-led downside on the other. Investors and policymakers must prepare for all of these outcomes.

item.title: Trump Announces Blockade on Sanctioned Oil Tankers to and From Venezuela
item.description: Choking off oil flows could be a backbreaker for President Nicolás Maduro’s rule.

item.title: Washington’s China consensus is breaking
item.description: Two factors are forcing a re-think: Trump's diplomacy, and the realisation that China's growth cannot be halted.

item.title: How dogs make teens feel less anxious
item.description: The beneficial relationship is much more than skin deep

item.title: Institutional Redesign for Economic Change
item.description: Economics now recognizes the importance of institutions for growth, as evidenced by the winners of the Nobel Prize in economics for the last two years. And yet, the institutions that comprise innovation systems have become semi-fossilized in many countries, and policymakers rarely think about how to reform them.

item.title: The Cambodia-Thailand Conflict: Can China’s Influence Tip the Scales?
item.description: Given Thailand and Cambodia’s close ties with China, it is necessary to assess how Beijing views the conflict and how its influence could shape the outcome.

item.title: Hong Kong Fire: Can the Government Keep Its People Safe?
item.description: The fire has stirred emotions that will not be easily contained.

item.title: Pakistan’s IMF Program is Buying Time. Markets Want To Know What Comes Next.
item.description: Pakistan has stabilized under the latest IMF program. But can it break the crisis-bailout cycle once and for all?

item.title: Innovation that Works for Women
item.description: For decades, women have had to navigate systems and products that were not built with them in mind. Now, as research and investment finally begin to catch up, companies and investors need to recognize that meeting women’s needs is the right strategy for the bottom line.

item.title: Understanding China’s Controversy Over Sealing Petty Offense Records
item.description: Setting aside the conspiracy theories, the controversy exposes flaws in the legislature’s mechanisms for consulting and informing the public.

item.title: Modi’s Pick for BJP Chief Is Little-Known Nitin Nabin
item.description: The appointment follows a recent trend of the Modi-Shah duo opting for low-profile leaders for key posts.

item.title: El Boletín newsletter: A new era in Chile?
item.description: Kinley Salmon, our Latin America correspondent, wonders if José Antonio Kast’s victory signals a clear shift to the right

item.title: Ukraine scrabbles for handholds against Russia’s massive assault
item.description: A counter-attack in Kupiansk is promising, but the overall outlook is not

item.title: The Iranian Regime Survived War With Israel. Now What?
item.description: The economy is wrecked, allies deposed, a once-fearsome militia humiliated. But Khamenei is holding the line while he still can.

item.title: Javier Milei loosens his grip on the peso
item.description: But there is more to do

item.title: The Worsening Geopolitics of Water in the Middle East
item.description: Countries across the Middle East are facing acute water shortages, owing to poor resource management, accelerating climate change, and regional power politics. In the absence of concerted diplomacy, water will soon be another flash point in a chronically unstable region.

item.title: Abundance as a Foreign Policy
item.description: The West’s new movement to revive liberalism still lacks an international agenda.

item.title: A Moment of Reckoning for Australia at Bondi Beach
item.description: An effort needs to be made to comprehend and counteract the political ideas, narratives, and movements that work like acid to erode social trust and encourage hate, division, and this week’s horrific violence.

item.title: The Slow Transformation of Kazakhstan’s Independence Day
item.description: Thirty-nine years after the protests that helped pave the way for Kazakhstan’s independence, the way the day is commemorated is quietly changing.

item.title: The US National Security Strategy: A Sobering Reality Check for South Asia
item.description: The paradoxical and selective U.S. posture of simultaneous disengagement and selective involvement evident in the new NSS could be particularly concerning for India.

item.title: Even as US Travel Bans Expand, Turkmenistan Gets Good News
item.description: Unique among those countries subject to travel bans by the U.S. earlier this year, restrictions on the issuance of nonimmigrant visas to Turkmen citizens have been lifted.

item.title: How the Green Transition Can Support Africa’s Development
item.description: Despite its vast renewables potential, Africa’s clean-energy transition is being impeded by deepening economic and debt pressures. Any credible climate strategy must combine coordinated debt relief with growth-oriented, low-carbon investment that strengthens resilience and advances long-term national goals.

item.title: Peace as an Economic Strategy
item.description: It is no secret that wars have driven extraordinary innovation, generating everything from the radar to the internet. But far less appreciated is the extent to which peacemaking could bring the same level of resources and collective effort to bear on some of humanity’s greatest challenges.

item.title: Europe Is Missing Its Moment
item.description: It’s time to finally reform—or risk irrelevance.

item.title: A red banner year for the PLA
item.description: For observers of the Chinese military, 2025 has been a year like no other.
